title: Bayern Munich boss Carlo Ancelotti facing punishment after sticking MIDDLE FINGER up at Hertha Berlin fans
text:
Sport Bayern Munich boss Carlo Ancelotti facing punishment after sticking MIDDLE FINGER up at Hertha Berlin fans Ancelotti admitted that he used the gesture following his side's late 1-1 draw with Hertha in the Bundesliga this weekend Share Ancelotti watches on during the draw with Hertha (Photo: AFP) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Carlo Ancelotti could face a German FA wrap after admitting putting his middle finger up at Hertha Berlin supporters. 
Bayern Munich boss Ancelotti made the offensive gesture at home fans but claimed it was in response to being spat on during a Bundesliga match. 
League leaders Bayern drew 1-1 at Hertha on Saturday thanks to Robert Lewandowski's stoppage-time equaliser. 
But Ancelotti was left furious by the conduct of the Hertha fans and was caught on camera appearing to raise his middle finger in their direction. 
When asked about the incident, Ancelotti told ARD Sportschau: "Yes, I made the gesture because I was spat on." 
ARD report that the German Football Association (DFB) will contact the former Chelsea, Paris St Germain and Real Madrid boss for his views on the matter. 
Ancelotti was not the only member of the Bayern team unhappy with the Hertha support. 
Goalkeeper Manuel Neuer expressed his frustrations with their conduct following the fixture. Lewandowski levelled the game in the latter stages (Photo: AFP) It was a hard-earned point for the league leaders (Photo: REUTERS) Lewandowski was clearly delighted with his late goal (Photo: AFP) 
He said: “What happened after the game has nothing to do with fair play, it doesn’t matter how frustrated you are. There’s a massive crowd here and it’s not setting a good example.” 
Lewandowski's goal six minutes into added time at the end of the game cancelled out Vedad Ibisevic's first-half opener for Hertha. 
It helped Bayern open up an eight-point lead at the top of the Bundesliga, which was closed back down to five after RB Leipzig's 2-1 win over Borussia Monchengladbach on Sunday. poll loading Will Bayern Munich win the Bundesliga this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
